_0_uWhmxKT6P5bDIydCDLQ.text: The booth we sat in was broke but no issues other than that.  The Buffalo Chicken pizza was amazing.  The server was friendly too. She did forget our drinks which was no big deal.

WGzgeB1HdaG_5BBewhBsjw.text: Bado's easily ranks in my top 5 favorite pizza places in Pittsburgh. Their pizza sauce carries a subtle sweetness that makes it unique to most other places in town, and their non-pizza cuisine is decent as well.   The atmosphere is nice. The service is friendly and almost always good. The restaurant does fill up quickly on most nights making it difficult to get in and get out. They have a great beer selection, though the bar area is small and easily overcrowds.  The only major negative is that when you order the potato skins, they hide the sour cream underneath the cheese so it can't be seen until it's too late. This can be quite a shock for those who prefer their skins condimentless.

rGC2twHV8oAUpQXj-MqImg.text: Love this place pizza! Breadsticks! I always get pizza from here. Everything's made in house. I hope as good for you as it is for me.

qBEWU92lRp9u_HDmoGdYKQ.text: I've been a regular at Bado's for a few years now, and have yet to be disappointed. I've had everything here; brunch (eggs can be greasy but everything else is good), lunch, dinner, PIZZA, even just for drinks, I've had it all here. Bado's pizza is one of the best pizzas I've ever had!  It can be a little pricey with toppings, but it's worth it.  I love their rotating beer menu as there's usually something to keep me happy. The service is always good as well. We usually sit at the bar so the bartenders know us well.  Bado's gets two thumbs up from this girl!

GitP5swHQL5WhMmDITNbtw.text: Four stars for the pizza! Great crust.  I usually don't eat the crust, but I couldn't let this go to waste.  We ordered the Leopold.  In the description, it noted a "hint" of anchovy.  It ended up being more than a hint, which was welcomed by my boyfriend and myself.   We'll be back when we're in the area.  I see this being a regular spot after our rounds of golf at Mt. Lebanon GC.

cgDAZ7O1X7AVOdKXkqkd1w.text: OK so the service may not always be the best, but where else can you find great pizza and what is possible the best Reuben sandwich in the South Hills!  Great for take out and not bad for dining in.

jqsL0AQWj7I4QaYq4-URFg.text: One of the best bar/restaurants in Pittsburgh. Great beer selection, great food, and friendly bar tenders. You can't beat having wings and beers at the bar on a game day.

GuxerGd5nK8Wx0ueyyXt0A.text: Ordered take out for medium cheese pizza, cranberry walnut spinach salad, and half cheese steak.....Terrible....won't order there again.

lb_0--bZkT8GrIFozx6apw.text: Great beer selection and the food is good. My gripes are that it's always so loud in there that I have to shout across the table, and the layout of the place itself is weird. It can be hard to get seating if it's busy.

qDLS8URk6PGA_o8mmjGXpQ.text: Very disappointed in our delivery order this evening. The potato soup was runny, and looked like milky water with a few potatoes in it. The wedding soup was less than fair. Thee Buffalo chicken sandwich had no lettuce or tomato on it. The Reuben and fries were soggy and greasy. The chicken salad, the lettuce was wilted, although the chicken strips were the best thing in the whole order. The turkey grilled sandwich also had no lettuce or tomato and was greasy and soggy and did not come with the chips and pickles as listed on the menu. For what they charged for this. It was a disgrace . We will not order again and will pass the word around. There are too many other  decent and less expensive delivery restaurants to ever order from there again. Disappointed.

s9gfVfvTc7zfhwws36LXJA.text: I went with my boyfriend and one of his coworkers to this joint for lunch last week. As the rating suggests - meh.  It wasn't terrible and the service was fine. I just feel like I've had much better pizza elsewhere around town. And for sure a better margherita. Theirs fell into the category that I find most end up in: a regular cheese pizza. Quite a few places seem to not understand the differences between the two, and this place was no different.  Now, the cheese/margherita pizza they served me was pretty good, but it didn't stand out for me. The other two ordered sandwiches of some sort that they both really seemed to like. The beer selection was also a bit lacking for my taste, but that may just be because they didn't have anything I liked so I stuck with water (that's me when I go out to eat: alcohol or water ;).

MYkHyfWFsHeNyE8cXz0eLg.text: The pizza is very good and the beer selection is great. The restaurant needs to improve on service. In the last two visits I received the wrong food and this time I had to get another drink at the bar because my waiter went missing for 15 minutes.

nrPwuKj5Z53_hWFq3oIbyg.text: Pillsbury dough delivery boy is rude and obnoxious!  We love the food but it's just not worth ordering from them when you have to deal with ignorant kid.

nwy5Nqt6RTHmn3hVo6_2zA.text: The food is ok. Would have probably given 3 stars if just reviewing the food. But, the entire place needs to be scrubbed from floor to ceiling. Lots of flies and other little thing flying around. Just not a great experience. And it's pricy - almost $30 for 2 sandwiches, an order of fries, and 1 soft drink.

2frokgNxMICXXJV7_AIu2g.text: We have had really wonderful experiences with this place along with really terrible ones. The same plain pizza we order never seems to taste the same. I ordered the same burger twice and it came different and not great the second time. The fries were ways very soggy and cold. We would keep ordering from them if we knew we could be paying for what we expected. I want so badly to like this place!!

2X4JcKpph_cHO89kqwhu0Q.text: This is a popular place so usually skip it due to a short wait list...just don't want to wait  for pizza and so many pizza shops in the area.  No wait on this Friday night.  Bado's has  all that you need..a good beer selection, neat atmosphere, and more than pizza..pub grub, lots of options here.  The wait staff was good and on the ball.    But the pizza is what most people talk about so we ordered "Bado's  Famous Pizza"   (the traditional, Our most popular crust)" and the hot wings.  It did not take long and the pizza and wings came out.  The wings were hotter than most places and pretty good.  The pizza crust was a little thicker and nice flavor and chewy, good though I tend to prefer thinner crust.  All in all, a nice place, good beer, good service and food.

1GWWcGoi2rAXBAQ_BRZm1g.text: Margarita pizza - best fucking pizza I've ever ate! End of story. On my commute home from work; will be eating one weekly. Just at 8 of 12 pieces. Time for power nap (8 hours) then wake up, bake up, and go to work. If you don't order this pizza...you fucking suck.

KQvXlFcD39xu5l-HX212TQ.text: Unfortunately, I'm not able to review the food or beverages. I was seated at the bar with only four other patrons and was never once even acknowledeged. After 12 minutes with absolutely no service, I left.

0daJ-aVZ26M-5EjUwMc_mg.text: The service is a little off and the staff doesn't seem very attentive to your needs. However the food is worth having bad service. They have a great selection of pizzas but my personal favorite is the buffalo chicken.

iAYTqroavC0AgeFw5F8XmA.text: one of the worst steak sandwiches i've ever eaten. there were 7 of us and the only people who liked their food were the kids and the one who had the pizza.   i would never eat here again

Q3pGItFX2bgh1R34jsyYdQ.text: Above average cost for below average food.  Got delivery -8 cut pizza with 1 topping and fish sandwich and a side of fries were $30. The pizza was ok according to my friend. The fish was lost in hard tasteless batter. Inside was a dry, thin, overcooked fish. The tartar sauce was buried under the fries and thus became warm and not appealing to help with the fish's moisture. The fries were a crime again humanity. Warm but floppy they were the type that were clearly coated with something breading like but without flavor. First time in a very long time i could not eat the 2nd fry.

MHyB6dQmRtjf5CUs1Td2vg.text: Best grilled cheese and fries EVER. And not sure if she still works there anymore, but Denise is a real treat!

nnI5TU3RxspvT_JMc1jnHw.text: Good pizza, good beer choices.  Wasn't a big fan of the new Leopold pizza.  Had a nice glass of Italian wine, great salad with their homemade dressing.  Wings are good, albeit the Frank's hot is HOT!  Hoagie have nice bread with the right amount of crunch to the edges.  Traditional pizza is very good.  Have been coming for years and will continue to do so.

QIEJTICrR_ppHpZDFWy_Qw.text: Hot wings just use frank's red hot - I ordered it anyway out of impulsiveness, but then I quickly realized I could make these wings with better chicken at home myself :/  The bruschetta uses thick cut pieces of soggy white bread instead of thin toasted pieces, and I hate the lack of textural contrast. The topping itself was also a bit meh - I usually order this for how refreshing it tastes but this dish felt rather heavy.  The wedding soup was pretty good - fit my need for some comforting soup.  I realize I didn't have pizza here, but based on this I'd be reluctant to come back and try their food again. It was OK, but I'm not a big fan of pizza in general, and my experience hasn't given me any reason to think that they could convince me otherwise.

5Vj3RajAd_be1Kphj76iQA.text: Back in my coaching days at Chartiers Valley this was one of my goto places in Lebo. The pizza is good, one of the best reubens in town and friendly bar tenders. The beer selection is pretty good, not great but a good selection. A nice gem in Mt Lebo.

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Upstairs bar

nAHNmQHcvQrS_iFVUV2WJg.text: I have been a patron of Bado's several times now, and this is a great spot to have few beers, watch a game, and meet up with friends.  Their beer selection is commendable and is frequently updated.  I have sat a the bar and had a table.  I've never had a problem with service.  Staff is knowledgeable and makes great suggestions.   Now for the food...their pizza is so yummy!  I love everything about it. The cheese, sauce, toppings...all great.  Their wings are also good.   It can get quite packed during a game or on a weekend evening, so there can be a wait.  Grab a beer and wait b/c it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Mmmm... Punk&#39;n beer

5hm86UlpmJC_qfjQjR5nrQ.text: I am not being hyperbolic when I say that my last experience here was the worst food experience I have ever had.   I have eaten at Bado's before and have had pizza that was pretty tasty. So when my roomate wanted to go there, I was pretty excited. There were 4 of us. Two of us had burgers while the other two ordered wedding soup and shared potato skins. My burger was delicious. It was juicy and smothered in bleu cheese.   While my food was really good, there were some issues with the other items ordered. Two of my guests cited that the wedding soup had a metalic taste to it while my other friend with the burger found a hair. Being a hairdresser and understanding that it does happen sometimes, she disregarded it and continued to eat her burger. Unfortunately, the hair did not stop there. Another guest found several hairs in their meal as well. We decided that we should let our waitress know. I stopped the waitress and explained how there was hair in two people's food. The waitress got upset and was very rude (it's not like we accused her of planting the hair herself). On top of this, she mistakenly took my burger and walked away with it, leaving the sullied food on the table. When she came back I told her that my burger was not one of the items with food on it and she instantly became defensive. At this point we asked for a manager (who never came) and insisted our meal get comped. Considering she threw out the only good food that we ordered, we didn't feel like that was asking too much. Luckily the waitress did not put up too much of a fight.   I will never eat at Bado's again. A good cheese burger and a decent pie isn't enough when the staff can't even accept their own (human) mistakes. I have been places where there have been food issues before and I have also worked in a restaurant. I completely understand that mistakes happen. However, the reaction that we received was unacceptable.

ioxEVVaOVVxH20vVnqOutw.text: All I have to say is that the pizza isn't even that good and wtf is the deal with this "Mt Lebanon"  2.5 charge for toppings?  $6+ for some toppings on an 8" pizza?! And service was so so so slow.   Overrated.

6DiCQ66AWv8PLET5GWUIOw.text: I have been going to Bados since my kids (now in their 20's) were little. Bados has evolved nicely, even if my kids haven't. Bados has an updated selection of craft Beers and ipa's The food is for the most part good. The "nachos" are a little weird. Our server was kind enough to explain to our group how they were served (cold with the toppings on the side) so there were no surprises. The Italian combo platter is large enough for 3 to share (appetizer). The veggie hoagie is a light choice. A little too much dressing but otherwise very tasty. I would order it again and request less dressing. I haven't had a Reuben for years (too much salt) but they were very good here in the past.

ODR0uxYTcEOH0ddqsc1tAg.text: Pizza is good but nothing remarkable.  Pretty much the same as any other decent place.  Far too many tattoos on the staff.

kLdGUCRBLpiOKXg2mB4kZQ.text: Traveling to try some Chicken Wings around Pittsburgh, we ordered Wings with 2 unique sauces. We tried the Guiness Honey Mustard and the Butter Garlic sauces. Both sauces were very good, I would like to highlight the Guiness Honey Mustard Sauce, it had a hint that deep Guiness flavor with the sweet flavor of honey mustard. If you are a lover of unique flavored wings, you should stop and try them. Now we also got pizza, IT WAS AMAZING! !!! Fresh chewy dough, a real tasty sauce and top notch mozzarella. Please check out a full review of the wings on facebook.com/chickenwing... .

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Pizza
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Wings

gJ-9YjYMO2xkVmoYnaeRoA.text: We just moved to Pittsburgh and have been delighted to find so many "family" pubs -- and this is one. A wide array of menu and drink options only add to the charm of a local favorite where -- if you visit enough -- everyone will know your name. Our server was Thomas and he was friendly, professional, and happy to share his knowledge of the restaurant and area. We will most definitely be back.

eR2o3eo6RTfNsrfvr5BzPw.text: So far I've had the Mexican pizza, Jalapeno burger & Philly Steak pizza. The burger was excellent, so were the fries! My husband's Philly pizza was amazingly good! I want more.  The Mexican pizza was okay. Not terrible, just had too much on it and was sloppy.   They always have a full house. There is no where to wait for your table.

zB2YndGxr2NRqDyJROSqCg.text: This is our first time here. We had heard from family that this was really good pizza place. We ordered both a thick and thin crust pizza...and they were both really good.  The sauce wasn't sour, and the toppings were fresh and tasty.   Now...as for the service...the waiter was grumpy. He did what we asked him to, but acted unpleased about it.   As for the integrity of the place...they have a permanent sign saying Monday special -  "$1 off draft beer (some restrictions apply)." We ordered 8 draft beers...4 different types. When the bill came, I asked the waiter about the Monday drink special. He had to go ask the manager, but explained to us it was only one 1 beer.  Try had dozens of draft beer, and how they make the mental leap of "some rstrictions" to damned near all restrictions show a complete lack of integrity.   The pizza was good...but the whole integrity issue raised the question of what else are they doing behind the curtain that may not be in the up and up.  Its good I live out of town, because I won't be back. No pizza is worth the experience we had here.

LIeDHMHtLGH27o0aE76PUA.text: Bados is a bar/restaurant located right on Beverly Rd. in Mt. Lebanon.  Great location, but it may take a few laps around the block to find a parking space.  I've been here more than a handful of times, and have never been disappointed.  They always have a healthy selection of craft beers.  My favorite item from the menu is their pizza.  Some of my favorites are the Gourmet Bianco (white pizza with feta cheese and artichoke hearts) or the Ferrari (eggplant, roasted red peppers, Sicilian olives, cheese).  Appetizers are usually good too, but I'd skip the calamari.    The restaurant also has TVs - depending where you are seated, it can be an excellent place to enjoy beer & good food.  Also great for brunch!  Definitely worth checking out!

jQF3i6Ju5_2yZ9aQUWq1dw.text: Bado's is a great casual place. Their margarita pizza is delicious! The restaurant is located on an adorable street with stores, a coffee shop and an ice cream place and Bado's is at the center of it all. The restaurant is great for take out, delivery and to eat in. There is outdoor seating on the rooftop and a big bar on the main level. It has good food and is a great place to hang out. They even have live entertainment some nights.

ZDG_sSaPFrNN_IWYIZMp9g.text: The service was good, the location is great...but the pizza was really not good at all.  We had two pizzas: a meat-lovers and a veggie, both on traditional crust.  The crust was extremely bland, the toppings and sauce were pretty sparse, and there was simply no flavor.  I'm really hesitant to post poor reviews, but there was no getting around it: the pizza was really bad by any standard.

GlqaXVvltnfsjGMKJzRUKQ.text: Great place to have a party!  Bado's is located in a cute section of Mount Lebanon with street parking or a metered parking lot in the back (it was only $5 for a 24 hour period).  Our friends rented out the top part of the restaurant for a 30th birthday party. This was a large space which could easily fit over 50 people comfortably.  There was a small bar with 3 draft beers to choose from, tables set up for food and tables to sit at.  We were served their huge pepperoni pizza which was very tasty!  The sauce was sweet and a thin crust.  Downstairs they had a nice selection of draft beers to choose from.  They also have a rooftop section!

rudNoXL1HsSS3HiwZ5ZdBQ.text: What in the world happened to this place? Hadn't been there for about 6 months and it's like night and day. First, terrible service. Young male server( I think his name was "Sorry" because he said it so many times) was clueless. My son and I ordered pizza and it was fine( although not as good as before) and my wife ordered a corned beef sandwich. The sandwich was dry and the fries bordering on cold( the few of them that were on the plate at least. Very small amount). When my wife mentioned it to Sorry, he said it was done before the pizza and sat there. That was that...no mention of getting new fries, new sandwich, free drink. Nothing!!  Upon telling Sorry that I wanted to see the manager, he was a big help also. Said he would let the owners know. I'm so thankful for that. Also, went to the rest room. Toilet paper laying in the floor, dirty, dirty, dirty. Also, the hostess standing at the podium playing with her cell phone was a nice added touch also. Bye, bye Bados !!!!!!!

2XQNX3jj1lMli5mYlK7JGw.text: Best pizza buffet in town! Also, best pizza in town! Have been coming here for years, family loves it! They treat you great, from the time you come till' the time you leave! Many choices on the menu! if you tell them you want it a certain way , they will make sure they do it for you, without any hassle!  Reubens are fantastic too!

WPqskzc7NqDFEqkNMiL4uA.text: I live in walking distance so I have been here many times . The place is very clean and the menu has many choices ... Not just pizza and hoagies . The bar is well stocked and has many varieties of beer . I would suggest coming here for breakfast or brunch on the weekends . The omlettes are huge . The only drawback is the place very small and can get crowded . You can't have a discussion without hearing what the people sitting at the next table are talking about as well . There is sometimes a wait to get a table . Good place to take the family , a date or just yourself . This place is alot like Vincents of  Green Tree.

jsbKQaNuErkYdG6QgP35SA.text: All of the staff here were very friendly and helpful. The fried zucchini appetizer was huge and very tasty.  The white thin crust pizza with spinach was very good.  Seemed like a great neighborhood restaurant and we will most definitely be going back.

tFPPW1zj6xqkpcCfqOss3g.text: One of my favorite hometown pizza places. Try the white pizza, you won't be disappointed. Great place to grab a beer on Beverly road and catch up with old friends.

yTAD2eFGoqhcTKkoQR6quw.text: The white pizza truly is delicious, as are all of their fatty appetizers.  They also offer pasta and other options so there is something to please everyone in any size group you bring to Bado's.

cYXCZGhrQbWEXQ31NYX1rA.text: i want to love this place. they have great pizza and a solid beer selection. and if you stick to pizza and beer you will probably be pleased. deviate though, and you are in for a disappointment.  the spaghetti was bland and in a portion that could have served three. the appetizers are poorly conceived and appear to be pre-made and just heated up. this place should scrap the rest of their menu and stick to what they know.

SiUbKFQEPBElRZ9nISSolA.text: Consumer Beware !!!!  This place is a joke! We had a party of thirty and had heard good things about this establishment.  The food is average at best (Same pizza as Cici's pizza as far as taste) We payed a little shy of 1000.00$ for two and a half large pizzas, a small pan of overcooked wings,  Two loaves of bread with some balogna and ham they called a hoagie, and a small salad. Thank goodness they had beer and wine(at an extra cost) for us to drink and two televisions to watch the football game on(But wouldnt turn any sound on)  . They told us it was an all you can eat buffet for our guest (most were over 60) but when the wings and salad were gone they would replinish it only for "An extra phenominal fee" . The people who wanted to enjoy a cup of coffee were also told so sorry,, That will also be an "Additional Cost"!! The money isnt an issue if they would have been up front and honest with us.  We all had a TERRIBLE experience here and unfortunately will NEVER step foot in this place again. And to top things off,,  The pizza and two so called hoagies that were left over(because they were all bread) and we payed for, We were told we could not take home because someone might get sick.   Im sorry, But I didnt pay to feed your staff dinner !!!!!   On a good note, The bartender was a great guy and very good at his job.

jQYIoqguyX3JWvS4zQCrvA.text: Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. They use a bread dough recipe handed down from their grandmother and a sauce that is to die for. Awesome beer selection as well. Word of advice from someone who's been dining here since they were across the street and known as Pizza Piazza - don't introduce yourself to the pizza via the lunch buffet - it's too delicate and dries out under the heat lamp. Order it fresh with extra sauce and enjoy!

-HJ_lfKTMer6fz0j3iaMVw.text: I love this place. I live within walking distance and I find myself there a lot. Tons of beer choices (microbrews for you beer snobs) and great pizza & pub food.  It's a perfect pizza pub in every way. Try the hot lime flavored wings. They make your eyes well up when you put your face over them to smell the amazing wing aroma. Nice bartenders and wait staff as well.

rfaHBMkQRG2b1XYjJ2iwQw.text: My favorite thing on the menu is the Margherita Pizza. It is a delicious, deep dish masterpiece. Their white pizza is also very good. Stick to the pizza here--the only other thing I had on their menu was a burger and it was not so good.  The bar is pretty cool - friendly bartender.  They are also very quick to deliver, usually within 20-30 minutes.

g3ACU2_E0hIoN3Zx6Nvh2w.text: Just got the pittsburgh style sandwich the " steak" was garbage , and the bread was moldy. I gave this place a second chance and they failed. Gross.never again!

Tkl3S97StOX-OjRtgTBcQw.text: Bado's is a definite neighborhood joint.  Located on Beverly in Mt. Lebo, it's super-busy during meal times.    Food can be hit and miss.  Best to stick with the pizza, which is pretty good, and the soup and salads, which are quite good.  Place also has a solid beer selection, which is reasonably priced.  That said, we've found that it's a total mistake to order anything else off the menu -- except at breakfast, which again is pretty good.  (Their omlets are huge!)  For example, we once ordered a spinach-artichoke app.  Sounded delicious.  Um... it was creamed spinach (probably of frozen origin) with some canned artichokes in it.  Disappointing to say the least.  Also be aware that they close the kitchen ... when they feel like it.  I didn't know that until we were drinking a few beers there a while back and they made a kitchen last call.  My sister asked the bartender when the kitchen closes -- he said, when we feel like it.  One thing is for sure, though, if you go with what they do best (Pizza and beer), you won't be disapointed.  Plus, the servers are True Pittsburgh and generally very sweet.

ThmPs5eXlRlGyaYlNtF4tw.text: Whenever I'm in Bado's I'm reminded of Nemo's, the fictional pizza joint from Everybody Loves Raymond. My first expierence with this place was two years ago, I had spent the entire day in the waiting room of St. Clair Hospital with my mother who was admitted finally at 8pm, she was fine and released a few days later. But at 8pm I was ready to eat anything and Bado's was on the way home. So I parked and walked I'm and the place was packed. Good sign. So a seat at the bar opened and the Pens were playing. So I ordered a bottled IPA and read over the menu. I needed to power carb after a long day of sitting in a hospital waiting room. The bartender who doubled as a pizza chef told me the white pizza was exceptional, so I took his advice and ordered a medium, figuring I could have it for lunch the next day. What arrived was this wonderfully thick, cheesy, reeking of garlic in a good way, just what I needed, comfort food that instantly made the days worries seem distant. The first bite was heaven, chewy center, crisp bottom, olive oil coating my mouth, ooey, gooey italian cheeses, saltiness from the black olives I ordered as a topping. This was pizza! Two slices and I was full, I drank my beer and paid the bill, and walked out with lunch and dinner for the next day. I must return here someday and have the same pie.

I3ed2cf6ooz3pRR--Na7LQ.text: The pizza is great. Other food items might disappoint. They do deliver! Service is hit and miss. There is one rude,  smile-less bartender... I have actually seen him through the window and decided to go somewhere else because I was in the mood for good service.

K9ZPL2gZFN3OkraNml-aVw.text: Tried their Sunday brunch. Menu was quite extensive, a lot to choose from and prices were reasonable. However, french toast was not good, mushy and not at all flavorful. Waitress seemed to know several customers as she spent a lot of time standing at their tables talking while we were waiting. Sadly, although this place is very convenient, we will not be back for breakfast.

t9TybPb_vBpNJEwyM-_6Pg.text: Ok, first time here after hearing good reviews and drove 50 minutes from north of the PIT airport. Showed up as a party of two and was asked if we could be seated upstairs, plenty of room downstairs so not sure what that was all about. But there is a huge decor difference between the two levels, downstairs is decent bar atmosphere while upstairs is very undesirable and outdated to say the least.  Nice beer selection so I was happy to try something new with dinner and was very pleased. We got the breadstick and meatball appetizer, I was very happy with the choice and I must say at first I was nervous. Only because the bottom of the breadsticks were burnt but they tasted fine. Meatballs tasted homemade, were very soft, and the sauce complimented the dish very well. Bado's sauce is very good, not sweet or bitter, not overly seasoned with spices, perfectly balanced which is hard to find. I was impressed! Now onto our dinner choices, my wife got a small pepperoni calzone which for her was her go to choice no matter where we go. She was happy with the calzone and even made the comment that she wished she would have gotten the large. I chose the large Buffalo chicken calzone and ended up taking half of it home which I intended to do. So here is where I get picky, while I loved the taste and texture of Baldo's dough the middle of the calzone was extra thick with dough. Making it chewy, the cheese wasn't melted but the calzone clearly looked cooked on the outside with two dark spots (which I love). Overall flavor was good, the chicken and buffalo sauce worked well together. So I have given 3 stars considering the total experience and my wife and I both agreed to come back and try the pizza.

4wO__4SzSBn2GTjmFUZW9A.text: My family had a last minute change of plans for a birthday lunch due to flu season and we needed an option outside of our house! They accommodated our party of 13 (8 kids Under 10!) with just one dayss notice. All our food was delivered to the table in record time and kept the whole crew happy and occupied and we were in and out in just over an hour. The food was great and our server Shane had the patience of a saint dealing with our big group! They even brought us plates and forks to enjoy the cake I brought from Home for dessert. As a Mt Lebo resident, I was already a fan of the restaurant, but now i am a lifelong customer. Thanks so much Bados for being so amazing!!!!

qgbnYo67iIsrRaS3wTWOAQ.text: I give Bado's on Beverly Road 2 stars. Two weeks ago I would have given them 5 stars because my baby Ruben was the best Ruben I've eaten for as long as I can remember.  So we went back for lunch on Saturday Dec 29th. I again ordered the baby Ruben with great anticipation....  Our waitress Kelsey was the best!   My plate came with all items on it a different color....  The fries were a darkened shade of brown.. The bread was toasted hard and brown.. When I touched the sandwich it was very hard -not warm-brown with burnt dark black rim. The meat sticking out the sides of the sandwich were a very dark burgundy black and they crunched like a burnt piece of bacon.  Kelsey gladly replaced the plate but when she brought something somewhat similar with lighter toast, the same burnt bacon on the inside.  This was a very unpleasant lunch experience.  I feel generous giving Bado's 2stars and they were given because of the first time we went weeks ago.  Don't know if and when I'll ever try it again. The experience left me with a really bad taste!!!

u8vmebCTyQ1z8k1TlgOjTg.text: My son and I are visiting the area and walked to here for a late lunch. He had a pizza and I had the chicken Cesar salad. Both were great and large servings. Our server, Carly, was attentive and helpful. Def recommend Bado's!

eRTR_U_iiF78rOPCeAPrMg.text: How have I not written a review for this place yet? I LOVE Bado's. It's right down the street from one of my old schools, so I have a lot of fond memories of eating here once a week or so with my mom during the school's lunch break.   With that in mind, because I often come here craving pizza and I was a child patron, I tend to just forget that, oh yeah: they have a full menu, and they serve alcohol as well. Not only do they serve alcohol, but my family has actually purchased six-packs from the bar since Bado's is easier to get to than a beer distributor. I think they have a decent but obviously not expansive beer selection if we're taking the time to buy and carry a six pack home.  As for the food? No complaints. The pizza is delicious, and Bado's also has a bunch of other meal options like sandwiches, soups and salads, so you're sure to find something here. All of my personal favorite dishes here are cheesy and come with standard but still tasty sauces that just complete the meal. One of my favorite things from Bado's is actually their calzones, which are enormous and yet, oddly enough, "light." Not light in calories, but light in the amount of grease and oils in the meal. This, of course, is compared to take-out chains, so I'm sure it's still way too much and not that good for you. But still, I've always felt that their calzones have the perfect blend of toppings, sauces, and so forth, and they're borderline divine - the perfect local splurge.  Just keep in mind, Bado's is popular and it gets crowded. Fast. Be prepared for a wait or try to show up during slow hours, i.e. not right after work - especially on a Friday. But really, other than that, I can't complain about this place. In fact, just talking about it makes me crave pizza...mmmmmm.

-B-ebRdeXQgDYbD76ns8OA.text: So I had a gift certificate from a local radio station to Bado's, so I checked it out. I want around seven on a Monday night, also Columbus Day if that has any impact, and there was really no crowd.  My server, Barry, was very nice and was very good.  Right off the bat, I'll explain why am taking two stars away. The service was a little bit too fast for me between my two courses as within maybe three minutes of my salad being taken away my pizza came right out. Normally I'm a fan of fast service but that was a little bit too fast for me. I'm also taking a star off, and whoever reads this review will probably think this is a stupid reason but this review is my opinion, because the salads with the exception of a few or overpriced compared to the other appetizers.  I had the grilled portobello mushroom salad and the 4 cut margherita pizza.   The salad was huge but great, the house Italian dressing complemented the salad really well. The salad was a nice mix of mushroom and greens, though I'd have preferred a bigger helping of greens. Of course you're not going to like this salad if you don't like mushrooms.   The pizza was tasty and pretty well done. Oh my goodness was it tasty. You could really taste the tomatoes and basil playing off each other and neither was overpowered by the cheese. Secondly, the tomatoes tasted fresh, not like the canned, heavily processed kind or tomato paste but like the diced San Marzanno organic tomatoes you can buy at fancier grocery stores. That went a long way for me with the pizza.   The con for the pizza: I have to say it was weird to me that the crust was this weird mix of crispy and kind of hard to cut and then perfectly chewy. The actual bottom of the pizza was crispy, like it should be so the pizza doesn't fall apart, but it was a little too crispy for my tastes as there were a couple points where I had a hard time cutting the pizza into bite-size pieces. I also have to comment that two of my slices, the two that I ended up bringing home because I was stuffed, hadn't been fully cut apart and that was a little annoying. I can overlook it, but it's still something I want to comment on.  This isn't the kind of pizza that you can easily just pick up and eat with your hands because there is so much to it. It's a very dense pizza.   I want to end this review by commenting on the slightly weird pricing for the pizzas. The pizza is priced based off of how many slices the pizza is cut into. And, I feel the pizza was a little bit pricey for the four slice pizza that I got, it was just under $13.   That all said though I had a fun time at Bado's and I'll go back.

lLqufU4iEzV4JAvpu3dAhw.text: The service was a tiny bit "off" during this second visit, but the food amply made up for a long wait and some missteps.   I recall first seeing deep-fried artichoke hearts on one of Bobby Flay's Food Network programs. Somewhat of a state fair treat, I'd never thought that they could be prepared in such a manner.   I've had them at least one other time since, and Bado's were almost as delectable. The ideally fried exterior revealed lush, steamy flesh inside, the horseradish mayonnaise (?) proving to be a cooling, creamy condiment for these morsels that retained their heat a good while after plating, surely burning the tongues of many an impatient guest.   Also thoroughly enjoyed was the Meatball Hoagie, which was generously overstuffed with meteors of succulent ground chuck, provolone, and a marvelously sweet and tangy marinara that smacked of freshly picked tomatoes, grandmothers, and massive pots that simmer for hours on end.   Bado's ain't a Bad place to nosh at, abitanti.

5k9YsrBYz5TEocmPJabE_Q.text: Stopped in and was just going to have a quick shot and a beer. The bartender greeted me in a friendly manner and I asked for a shot of Jameson and an Anderson Valley Spring Horn'in IPA. While reviewing the menu I noticed that on this particular evening the special was cheese lasagna with garlic bread and a salad.  Hummm, for $7.95, how could I resist?  The salad came out quickly with what you would expect on a salad: lettuce, tomato, spinach, cucumber, onion mushrooms and croutons. They also had my favorite dressing, raspberry vinaigrette, which always scores points with me. But what struck me most was the sheer size of the salad. For a side salad this was huge; not a meal in itself but definitely bigger than I've gotten at most places.  It didn't take to long afterwards for the Lasagna to come out. In following suit with the salad, it was a huge slice covered in a tasty, tomatoey, tomato sauce. A slice of garlic bread accompanied it. Like I said, it was a cheese lasagna and there was no shortage of ricotta between pasta layers. A layer of sausage or ground beef would have done wonders for this lasagna but it stood well on its own just fine. I enjoyed half of it (how much carbs does one man need?) and put the rest in a take home container for lunch tomorrow. I think I'll pick up some of those frozen pre-cooked meatballs and add them to it to balance this lasagna out.   I've been to Bado's before and have always experience solid service, relevant craft beers and good food. This evening was no exception.

Il4dNAwWC8VJElTSmYAZzg.text: Love this place. Great beer selection, friendly servers and bartenders, love the pizza. I always get the sausage, red pepper, and sun dried tomato pizza with regular crust...it never disappoints. They are generous with the toppings and cheese. Good crowd. Nice place to come with friends or just to belly up to the bar alone. Definitely worth a regular visit.

HDDNh1SPEjpu3Y0uKVJTwQ.text: Huge salad served on a small plate? Horrible drink (old Fashioned)? Spaghetti--huge amount, no taste? Noise level--painful? Why I will never return?

rw8kW1cp_z7Mzal9h-6s2w.text: Delicious pizza. Amazing beer selection. We don't live anywhere close to this place, and will drive 45+ minutes for their food and ambience. Whenever I have family visiting, and we have the time, we trek over for a delicious dinner at Bado's. Be sure to check out their chalkboard with the drink and food specials!  We've never had any problems with the service or the food, and will definitely be back!

hemdQQdwnaUf8F4u9W1gcQ.text: Bado's is good.  They have three styles of pizza:  regular (doughy crust), thin/crispy, and thick/Sicilian.  I like their regular.  The dough has some good flavor, and the bottom has just a little "snap" to it.  I have not tried the thin.  The Sicilian is too doughy for me - almost like a double-stack of "regular."  The sauce is proper tomato and is not too sweet.  Cheese is adequate, and toppings are good, and laid on pretty heavily.  I've had the meatball sandwich (very good) and a few salads (fresh and good).  I also like the variety of beers on tap.  This place is bigger inside than it looks outside, and is good for kids/families (they have a kids' menu), as well as for adults on the bar-side.  Lots to like here.

qtMareErGVwOFDhettdtew.text: Today our service was drastically different. We have had a few visits since my last review and I feel that this update is very necessary.     There is no service for your phone data, but you can use their wifi hidden in their table menu.     We started with provolone sticks. They were served with marinara and horse radish sauce. The horse radish was actually very good with them.      The grilled chicken salad was ordered with balsamic, which I recommend. Served with the ole Pittsburgh fries, as well as onion, tomato, pepper, and mixed greens.     The kids hot dog was a hot dog. For an up charge, you can get the apple sauce instead of fries. My kid inhaled it all.      The pizza was a regular 8 cut with pepperoni and meatball, my sons choice. The dough was soft and fluffy and sweet. The sauce is sweet with a pepper taste, very good. The meat and cheese were cooked well with a consistency of soft cheese and crispy pepperoni and well done meatball. Overall the pizza here is a slam dunk.     The service today was very good. We were attended to quite well. Everything, from putting our order in and getting our food, was done timely. The service, the last few times we've come, has been much better since my first review. We usually come when it is not too busy, around 4:30. I've been here around lunch and they have some lunch specials that I think you can check out on their site.     Overall, it is good here. The prices can be a little steep, but the quality and quantity are adequate.

0H-95X9hiBA1Tsa-aXwrNg.text: Stopped in on a Sunday afternoon with a group of 11, nice menu lots of choices. Once decisions were made food came out hot and a lot of it. Waitress )sorry forgot her name) was good and accommodating with our group and never once missed a beat. Would say if in that area again would stop back to try some different choices...

Qcy3kNm87NqC81rwjboiAw.text: Bado's is a quintessential Pittsburgh pizza stop. I may even consider it the best pizza in Pittsburgh! I hadn't been in since 2008 or so which was pre-food allergies for me. My friends got pizza and said it was the best they had had in a long, long time. I really don't think you can go wrong with any of the toppings.  If you've read some of my other reviews, you know I have 14 food allergies. This makes it almost impossible to dine anywhere, but when a restaurant feeds me with ease, I am a happy camper! They accommodated me with no problem and I had a delicious grilled chicken salad! I was very impressed.  My mom was not too keen on her bruschetta wedge salad, mainly because of the dressing (which is homemade, however I do love their homemade greek dressing!). She still managed to devour most of it, though!  The staff could have been a little friendlier, but they made a meal happen for me, so no complaints!

oltBZNwg52hvnNABXXaxwQ.text: Two stars , and only because of the friendly and conscientious staff who did their best to make amends for the greasy pre-stamped fish sandwich and my guest's flavorless baked fish. Food wise, I was leaning towards just one.  Coleslaw must've had five spoons of sugar mixed in the sauce. I hear they have good pizza. I only ordered the fish because of its "famous" appellation on the menu. I not only took the bait, I guess I ate the bait too!

BrR8yL8fFIxqKrTDgRIs8g.text: I really, really want to love this place because it has so much going for it....above average food, close to my house and top notch beer. But every time I go, the service is below average. I know most places in Pittsburgh aren't very attentive when you are eating and drinking as a solo patron, but it would still be nice to have some acknowledgement beyond food order and check. Other than that the pizza is pretty good (although not my favorite in the area) and the lunch time buffet is a great bargain.

_OZX0EiB_V--TrSnRZLL5Q.text: New Years Day: Hangover is at an 11, I need to drop my dear friend off near Bado's. I figure, well I might as well order a pizza since everyone is always raving about this place. I called it in. Sicilian pizza with pep. Not my choice, the fiance wanted it and I obliged. 30 min to pick up. Okay that's fine. We ride out, we decide to go in a have a beer. Then 2. It's been an hour and a half and i've not mentioned to anyone that I ordered a pizza for pick up. It's cold by the time I shuffle out. I put the thing in my car and head back to the east end. Get home, open the pizza. Luke warm. We both grab a slice. It is AWESOME. Maybe I'm so used to having shitty pizza, but this is definitely the best pizza I've had in Pittsburgh thus far. The cheese and pep were cooked to a golden perfection. The sauce wasn't over powering. The sauce/bread/cheese ratio was exactly what I needed for my hangover stomach. Will definitely make the trek out there again.

2dVu6hNiyVO_2AkSRs20eA.text: Bados is a cute little place to grab a meal. We ordered potato skins, the margarita pizza and breadsticks. The pizza was good, but wasn't what we were expecting. It wasn't the standard margarita pizza that we have been used to, but it was still good.  The pizza had an extremely liquidy tomato sauce with large chunks of tomatoes. It was topped with a little regular shredded cheese and a couple small pieces of fresh mozzarella. It would have been better if there wasn't so much liquid in the sauce to make it soggy and if there was more fresh mozzarella. I love tomatoes so I enjoyed it. However, my boyfriend doesn't mind them, but doesn't love them so didn't like it. The tomato is definitely the dominant flavor and absolutely the main ingredient in the pizza. The breadsticks were good and weren't greasy (something I hate) and the potato skins had a unique twist with their cheese selection. Service was good too.

hQYPLyrBYybqS5udXrqxuw.text: I am a fan of all-you-can-eat lunchtime pizza buffets, and I visited Bado's today to try their buffet.  I found it to be adequate.  The price, at $6.95, is fair for what you get, but unlike some of my other favorite lunchtime pizza buffets, this one does not include the drink, so that is extra.  It does come with a soup or salad included in the price, and I chose the Wedding Soup, and unfortunately, I was not enamored by the soup at all.  It didn't have much taste, and even after adding salt, pepper, and grated cheese, it still wasn't very flavorful.  As for the pizzas, they had three choices, Pepperoni, Plain, and Supreme.  I thought the pizzas were just O.K.  I am not a big fan of pepperoni, so I personally found the choices a little limited, since two out of three had pepperoni on them.  I did try a slice of each, and they were fine, but the taste to me was just average.  I was hoping that they might bring out a different style of pizza once the first pies cleared off, but they only brought out another pepperoni while I was there.   Overall, it was a decent lunch buffet, but in my opinion, there are better ones in the area.

Fresh, homemade, pillow like crust to dunk in unlimited, on your table ranch, to your heart's desire. This place is the real deal. God bless America and Bado's -- I can't wait to see you again.

D1ED431Tszi1d0PPE8Uqzg.text: I went to Bado's with some friends on a Sunday for brunch. We had a fairly large group, but they were able to seat us quickly which is always a plus in my book. They have a great beer selection, and the brunch menu had something for everyone! I got the chicken and waffles, it was huge so I probably should have shared it, but I didn't want to. I was very happy with my choice, and everyone else loved their food too. The lunch and dinner menu definitely has something for everyone too. The atmosphere and service was great - perfect for a chill hang with friends!

hNkm-RcSXE92jGIMPLN9Ug.text: I was hungry for a Reuben & The Burgh seemed to me like the town that could make a great one. How right I was!   Bado's makes one that's absolutely everything you could hope for in a Reuben. A huge pile of corned beef & bread toasted perfectly brown.

nOtugKOHi4g3wyGW75itRQ.text: Was the pizza even cooked? Wow!! Severely disappointed , heard it was great pizza. Dear lord!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Cheese is barely melted and pepperoni was just thrown on. Cheese fell off the pizza. It&#39;s a shit pizza

l9OWEmiEAj2fcrOo0PErbw.text: We recently hosted an event at Bado's for our family.   I was able to easily speak with the event coordinator and set up the details of our event when I called. I customized the menu a bit due to some food allergies and called in two weeks ahead of time to confirm our count for our "adult pizza party" off of the banquet menu.  When we arrived, we were able to set up early and get ready for the event. Everyone was able to fit comfortably in the space and since the private room is upstairs, you also have access to the outdoor deck area. The room was clean and well laid out. There were also 2 TVs, a private bar, and the outdoor deck.  For food we had a mix of veggies and various dips, sandwich ring, and pizza. The pizza was probably the biggest party pizza I'd ever seen and was a big hit with guests. Included in the pizza party per person pricing were also three beers that were on tap.  The one weird thing was that at the end of the party there was some leftover food (i.e. about a quarter of a pizza); so as I was paying the bill I of course asked for it to be boxed up. Before this there was no indication that it was "catering" style and that any leftover food was to be left in the restaurant. I was told that the food could not be boxed due to house rules. I didn't understand since I had literally just paid for all of the food, but wasn't able to take it with me. It also wasn't explained well when I asked about it. In general it made me feel like they were being super sticklers and honestly ruined my excitement about telling others about the good parts of our experience.  For what the party was, it was a great room to host an event, but there are definitely some oddities that need worked out.

_fYZfWeFm9XGAkoufjucxA.text: Night didn't start off too bad. Had a drink at the bar while we waited for our table. The bar tenders there are always very nice and accommodating. Once seated at a table is when the night went south. Our waiter seemed pretty disinterested in being at work as he moaned and groaned during introduction. I ordered the 'Famous' fish sandwich and my wife ordered a Cajun burger. Well the 'Famous' in my food title must stand for famously bad. It was the worst piece of fish I have ever had...it was flat as a pancake...no flaky white fish to be seen.  I'd equate it to eating a sponge full of grease. The only taste out of it was from whatever other food shared the grease bath. Maybe I could have disguised the taste with the condiments I asked for but the disinterested fellow I mentioned before didn't bring them until asked and the sandwich was half done. As for my wife's burger...the taste was good but it was way over cooked since she ordered medium and the burger was well done. I'd return for a drink if ever passing by, but can honestly say I'd never come back for a meal there. Too bad because it's a nice little neighborhood to visit.

IOboitTaoFbh-p5NuhVjiA.text: Insalata pizza is awesome. Meatball sandwich and appetizer are delicious. We always get delivery and never late or delivered cold.  Highly recommend

7RLqgekyhWwutJ8QY9Thow.text: I visited Bado's for the first time and found them extremely accomodating.  I'm a vegetarian and needed my Reuben made with portabella mushrooms instead of meat.  They we're happy to do this and IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!  Going back ASAP.

nL85hcWVbLpbNiZvHTZWZA.text: This place has really gone downhill.  The lack of service today was probably the worst out of all the times I've been to Bado's.  Came in with a party of three and waited 20 minutes and still no one came to our table...not even drinks!  I get it if you have a packed house but there were seven tables and 3 people working there.  We ended up leaving and still no one said anything.  Extremely disappointed.

Hd3aA8uC21l7v-FFQbNYUQ.text: I've been to Bado's a few times now mainly to try there nice selection of craft beers but this time I actually tried there pizza for lunch! Me and a friend ordered an eight cut Florentine Pizza pizza with out diced tomatoes and it was delicious. Only thing that was disappointing is our pizza was suppose to have Sicilian crust and it came out with regular instead. We ended up keeping the pizza but they did offer to replace it but due to time constraints we could t wait.  Overall the pizza was excellent I would like to see how it tasted with the actual Sicilian crust

TgNWmjHrGh-ZJmYVCieipg.text: Good pizza, good food and even better beer. Plenty of tvs to watch your favorite game. The bar area is good sized and they're usually packed so you'll probably have a wait.  The parking is always very difficult to find a spot and is paid meter parking.

_fToaVWwpCGDKQtGTsBx-A.text: Casual, rustic pizza house with a bar attached. Check their website for daily specials - pizza buffet, all you can eat spaghetti, lasagna night, etc., all at extremely affordable prices!  I visited this establishment on a Tuesday and had the pizza buffet- the buffet has standard pizzas (pepperoni, cheese, supreme, and then a specialty pie, for example a margherita pizza). The buffet was small but had pizza to suit anyone's food personality! It also comes with a small house salad, and their dressings come in large bottles that they leave at the table; I got ranch dressing with my salad (which tasted homemade and delicious) and I was glad that they left the bottle so my boyfriend and I could dip our pizza crusts in a little big of the dressing!   Also, on the buffet night, they had a balloon artist who makes flowers, headbands, or swords for the kids, a really nice touch. The kids at he tables surrounding us were all giggly and happy when the man was delivering their balloon gifts!  Also, it is worth noting that the bar area is separated from the restaurant section almost completely with a wall; so no need to worry that you and your family will not be able to enjoy each other's company or feel uncomfortable with little ones in the bar. Just ask for a booth by the window in the restaurant area and you will be farthest from the bar and you will be able to feel comfortable with your little ones.

ZqJeXh-tFAiccnH1LDL0mQ.text: Last time trying Bado's. Ordered takeout. Rude customer service order. Restroom at restaurant still like a wild western with swinging doors that do not lock and do not have a purse hook. And very rude bartender to pickup/pay for order which included burnt meatball calzone.

V43Z15idwmhGSmt19sZ62w.text: Bado's is a family favorite for us. We moved into the neighborhood 8 years ago and they've been our go-to for awesome pizza since the day we moved in. The dough is yeasty and obviously house made. The sauce is perfect, with the tiniest bit of heat, but not any sweetness like some places. They use quality cheeses and toppings.   My *only* gripe is that sometimes the cutting of our pizza seems to have been done by someone with a very dull cutting blade, which is a small pain in the butt.   We have had their sandwiches, salads and other items too and they're all good. The pizza is where it's at though.

onz9gpRR0MCpeiuzkdJ3eQ.text: Got the Bianco white pizza 8 slice. Huge pieces could definitely share with three people maybe even four. Huge chunks of artichoke, generous helping of fets, and nice chewy crust. Must get!

JivWvgDXXeh_kV3RESkHaw.text: So literally as I'm writing this review my wife and I are sitting here waiting to be waited on.  We were greeted at the door and seated.  Fast forward 20 minutes and nobody has stopped by for anything.  Once I finish typing this we're leaving.  I'd stay and complain, but don't feel like eating a pizza with spit as a topping.

QaiC6MdAVkoDTMpgBcssWQ.text: Stopped at East End Brewery, saw the Bado's truck parked there, spouse ordered a pastrami Reuben......OMG, seriously the best Reuben ever. We just might have to venture over the river and through the tunnel to get to Bado's to sample their menu.

nWr9MpSikDyy2A7ysD3aUA.text: Great breakfast!  New low carb items yummy.  Eggs with choice of veggies and cheese.  No guilt and delicious.  Watched my daughter eat the Belgium waffle with chocolate chips-finished quickly.  Still a little jealous-lol
