Cb-QxyNhjdn2TG1dgTzDXQ.text: Went on a Friday night. It was busy but we were seated right away. It took about 10 minutes for a server to approach our table. From there, the wait time was reasonable. The pizza is just average. Too much sauce and cheese in my opinion, which made it difficult to eat. On another note, there was a very loud table in the dining room. They were taking so loudly that two tables near them left after placing their order. The owner asked them to keep it down but they were drunk and clueless. Probably won't return.

jsgzlfadVNlGJIFM5RwsjA.text: First of all at my place of work, there aren't many places to eat.   In comes the food trucks....Thank you! Bado's food truck stopped by and have to say, one of the best food trucks in town. With the pizza ovens firing along with the grill running the smell of pizza and cheese steaks wafted into our complex.  I went out with a couple work buddies and we each had the cheese steak. Have to say the $10 combo meal of the cheese steak, which was loaded with steak, mushrooms, and onions, along with chips and a drink was well worth it and phenomenal tasting.   Everything came out ready in under 5 minutes and was piping hot.   Will recommend this food truck and grille whenever they come around.

Apsb757DMUjYdgm0Szgwfg.text: Terrible dining experience. I've been here for both brunch, and dinner in the past month. I didn't review brunch because I thought it was a fluke; however after having dinner here this weekend I am sure to say that this place has some work to do.  My food the other night was awful. I ordered a Greek wrap, and asked for very light cheese. Instead I got a Greek wrap with TONS of cheese & hardly any vegetables. It was more like a lettuce wrap.   When I asked for more veggies, I was brought a cup of lettuce, tomatoes, and black olives...   Ordered a second glass of wine. When our server brought our a glass that looked like a taste sample I was confused. He told me it was the bottom of the bottle, and they were all out. He then told me that it would be 1/2 price, if you could see the look on my face....  I asked him to bring me another type of wine, and that I shouldn't have to pay for a splash of wine. Of course when the check came it was still listed, and then had to be removed.   This is the busiest restaurant in Beverly Rd Shops and I'm not sure why. Would be open to coming back for a pizza but that's about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Greek Veggie Wrap
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Wrong veggies
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Where are the veggies?

HQZKTH4AWdkGwP7DgCA2YA.text: Horrendous service. Rotten lettuce in the salad. Waitress needs to change her career path!

M3vK5UPHyQTFIJHeDidftA.text: Pizza was extremely disappointing, not what it used to be. Dough had an inconsistent roll, way too thin on half of the pie, no sauce and very little cheese. Also had a sandwich calzone that was terrible. The whole bottom of the calzone was completely soaked in grease and a disgusting soggy almost raw dough mess. I will not be wasting my time fighting to find a parking spot to come back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Way too thin, inconsistent roll out of dough
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Large cheese

kT-6UAPz5UaJK8VDB75GjA.text: I ordered Bado's while on my trip to Pittsburgh, and it was the best pizza I've ever had!  I ordered the Meatball gourmet pizza and it was FANTASTIC! Definitely recommend to give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Meatball Gourmet Pizza

gCx2oZRfhPWCs2CHfhFa_g.text: Bado's is the kind of place you go when you don't feel like cooking and just want to have a relaxed, casual meal with your family. Unfortunately, tonight we didn't experience anything close to that. To be fair they were busy. It was a Friday so that was to be expected. Our waitress did say that the kitchen was a little backed up but we were in no rush.  We ordered right away.  We sat, we waited. We kept our 8 year old entertained with games of would you rather and 20 questions. Finally our waitress returned with my entree. Just mine. She said the other food would be out soon. I tried to wait to eat but as my food got cold everyone insisted I eat. So I ate slowly hoping their food would come. It didn't.   I finished and we sat debating if we should just go home and boil some pasta and call it a night. Finally, nearly 90 minutes after ordering our food it arrived...and was subpar. My daughter's meatball was undercooked, the sauce was bland and my husbands hot pastrami sandwich had a nice cold slice of provolone on it. In 90 minutes you would think the cheese would have at least been melted...  I get it, people get busy, things go wrong in the kitchen. But in a case like tonight the restaurant should have at the very least bought us a round of drinks. We will not be back.

B5HKk0CZl3MTOar0eh8abg.text: Was at a pizza cook off at Grist House and decided to try Bados.  They had their new food truck their and I was stoked!  They had 6-7 personal pizza options... when I'm trying a new pizza I like to go with a classic and went with the pepperoni.  The wait was a little longer than I liked, but Grist was packed and I was hungry!   Pizza came out and could easily be shared with 2 people.  It was covered in really tasty thin pepperoni, a healthy amount of cheese and good quality tomato sauce.  The crust is thinner, solid crisp, very good.    4 stars because to me this is not THE BEST pizza in the burgh, but still very good! They could also work on wait times :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Pepperoni personal pizza from the food truck
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Pepperoni pizza from the food truck

IAYRvVvlRHPGp-5q86aP-w.text: Haven't everything on the menu but the pizza is great. They have a great kid's night with a balloon artist which is great keeps the little ones amused! It was a bit bumpy at the door to get sat but for all I know maybe the hostess was new. The servers were attentive. They have a great brunch!

rD1oPxKaEj_85VeJ8Znvkw.text: We tried this the other night and the food was good! Lots of beer options, some wine, and specialty cocktail list. I had their holiday sangria and it was really good! They have daily specials and a typical pizza place menu. There were lots of options. I would definitely go again.

Y6KkRlXyMg86zGOc6ELg7Q.text: If I'm going to be totally honest, I saw reviews for this place last week on Yelp and a picture of their meatball pizza and simply had to have it. I came here around noon on the weekend but they were only serving brunch and I was initially disappointed. However, after sharing with the server that we came for pizza, she asked the kitchen if they would make it and they agreed to. Such great service and that was really appreciated!   The pizza was everything I hoped it would be. The crust was fluffy, the sauce savory, and the meatballs were fantastic. The ricotta cheese went perfectly with the meatballs and the banana peppers were the cherry on top. I'll be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States

zBkQkQALnXpxPIn_k0lKiA.text: If there's anyone that loves pizza in any form or shape it's me.  I love them all deep dish, thin crust, ny style, grilled, wood fired - you name it - I love it.  It's always been my weakness - I can't resist it.  That is until we got pizza from here.  This is a first for me - usually if I don't particularly love it I can doctor it up somehow with additional seasonings or crisp up the crust somehow to make it edible.  Unfortunately there was no help here. I thought it might've been the style we got but we had two different kinds NY style and Sicilian style - both were terrible and inedible.  The crust on both had no flavor and seemed like it wasn't cooked through. And the sauce tasted like what you get from an elementary school cafeteria and I can't finger it but it was either too sweet or possible slightly rotten.  I have never thrown pizza away till now and it made me incredibly sad.  Wings were not that great either.  I hate to leave a bad review but was sorely disappointed.

P1bSPQ-g4R4Lz95o577JAA.text: Stopped in here for lunch. Place is relatively dark inside but staff warm, friendly and helpful. I learned that if you come during the week for lunch they have a pizza and salad/soup bar for less than $7.00. The only type of pizza on the bar is cheese and pepperoni.  I decided to order a thin crust veggie pizza in the smallest size they had. I got my food fairly quickly. Normally you pay by the topping(s) but some come premade up which is what I got. I did learn that if I could not finish it then would wrap it up for me.  The pizza was okay. Nothing overly spectacular about it and I was amazed at the fact I was able to finish it. Probably since I had ordered a thin crust it wasn't quite as filling as I would have thought it to be. I did enjoy the vegetable toppings since they are my favorite.  My ice tea seemed a bit strong but it came with lemon and I was okay with it. They have a huge bar on one side along with TV sets.  They have other items on the menu but pizza is their specialty. Located in the heart of the Beverly business district in Mt Lebanon pay metered parking is available outside or in the lot behind the row of buildings on this side of Beverly Blvd.

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. 4 thin crust veggies pizza
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. How to order your pizza
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. All you can eat buffet today

kM93SrVuICOhWHIQGcaF_w.text: Ordered take out and was told it would take 30-40 min. It's been an hour and currently still waiting... I don't mind if I wait at home for my food, at least tell me the right time to come get the food instead of waiting.   Update: after waiting a little over an hour for the food my pizza was cold.

eunP9ZLl4h5MTJqveZ3Ohw.text: Don't try to order delivery unless you want to wait two hours to only have someone hang up on you when you call to ask about it. Plenty of other options.

5ADRHBecgpt3GnyTbJV2ng.text: Love it love it love it , Came here on my vacation.. Drove from Southern California to Pittsburgh.. Glad I came here to eat pizza .. the best I have ever tried .. and there calzones where just as good .. When I come back again to Pittsburgh will definitely do a trip to come back here .. 10 out of 10

o8XKmk2EV3neB_xp3Bi3tA.text: Really like this place because of their diverse menu.  You can get their pizza, but they also have a lot of other options to choose from.  Two of my favorite non-pizza items here are the buffalo chicken hoagie and the reuben.  The reuben is one of the best in the area.    The pizza here is one of my favorites.  I go with the traditional crust.  It is thicker than places like Fioris or IVP, but the dough is fresh and cooked perfectly.  All of the ingredients they use seem to be high-quality and it makes for a great pizza.  Great place to come for lunch or dinner.  Also, their Tuesday buffet is a great bargain.  Make sure to show up early though because it gets packed.

hi8zLkCECpFIQ7683K-AxQ.text: My husband & I are Bados regulars. The very first time we ate there, we had a terrible experience.  We decided to give it another chance whenever we moved right up the road, and I'm glad we did. We get takeout at least twice a month, and sometimes eat in too. They have a nice breakfast menu. Recently, they had a special that was egg nog French toast, and it was really good. Typically, we get lunch or dinner. I absolutely love their vodka sauce. I usually get the pene vodka add Italian sausage and it never disappoints. One thing they could work on is getting some real garlic bread. They use hoagie buns to make "garlic toast" and it's not very good and always over toasted.  Not sure why they don't use regular Italian bread. The hot Italian hoagie is pretty good, and my husband loves their pizza. Their house Italian dressing is delicious and the anti pasta salad is a great deal. I always get two meals out of it. Bados service is decent and they have a nice deck upstairs for out door eating whenever the weather is nice. If you're on beverly, give it a try.

VBEwYXTY85fE3fJYzJ2PYQ.text: Ugh, I hate this place with a passion. The food looks and tastes excellent I just don't understand why the kitchen (s) are ALWAYS so dirty?

RnR5bPeIBkIeOVbhluejtw.text: Amazing chewy crust (I asked, the friendly bartender said the secret is it's actually a bread recipe), sweeter plum tomato sauce, chill local staff, WALL of drafts in chalk because they change up, pizza and beer happy hour 3:30-5:30. Tuesday night balloon guy and all you can eat pizza buffet $7 6-8pm. Nice modest music volume and atmosphere during Happy Hour, can get busy during rushes and metered parking lot costs (but not hard to find a space, meters take nickels, quarters, and credit cards). Also an upstairs party room and outdoor deck depending on weather.  Definitely recommend the Margherita pizza, with the buffalo mozzarella and fragrant fresh basil. Tonight I'm enjoying their signature Leopold Square Pizza with the amazing dough, lightly applied but flavorful marinara, sweet sauteed onions play great with the optional salty Anchovies to kick it up a notch (I get the fishies on the side because my wife doesn't like them, and Bado's accommodates). Seriously crave worthy pizza! I want to try the cannoli and Oreo waffle sundae sometime, but I always eat more pizza than I need and feel full, haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of Bado's Pizza Grill & Ale House - Mt. Lebanon, PA, United States. Just a warning, the margarita pizza takes the longest to cook, but it tastes amazing!

5LGLtceoYpNMNqfnaYCGvQ.text: This review is for the food truck they have, It was out front the science center where they were ripping off the family crowd.   This might be the worst pizza I've ever had, and I'm being nice, considering it came from a truck.  Sauce was waaaay too seasoned with some dry parsley and other crap.....and the crust.....man that crust....I had to drive Fiori's and eat a slice just for therapeutic reasons. I didn't know pizza crust could be so flavorless and texturally unappealing.  I seriously didn't know pizza could be this bad AND EXPENSIVE, and rightout front the Science center where they know people have no other choice cause the cafe is closed.   Gauging from this truck, I will avoid that restaurant like the IRS.

o4G1lJoL9R_xhuaCkiJKiw.text: Friday evening, my folks called me up and said they were out toward Mt. Lebo and asked if my wife and I wanted to meet for dinner. We said sure, and they chose Bado's. The place is nice with a warm, inviting atmosphere.  Our server was friendly, but clearly dealing with to my tables. He actually made me feel anxious when he'd stop by! My family decided to split a traditional pizza with pepperoni and mushroom. My wife and I added a dozen Guinness/ Honey Mustard wings and split a Reuben.  The wings came out in record time and were pretty good. Although, I still don't think the Guinness aspect did anything for the flavor. They sure tasted like any other honey mustard wing I've ever had.  The Reuben was average, but very large. It came with potato chips and a pickle spear. For the $9 price tag, you'd think they could do fries over chips.  The pizza was good; not great. Based on reviews, I thought the pizza would be even better. Maybe I'm being a bit picky, but there are enough great pizza joints in the city that you can afford to be.  All in all, Bado's is a nice place to have a casual dinner. I wouldn't go out of my way to try it, but if you're local give it a go. If you want an inviting atmosphere where you can enjoy a beer, have some pizza and enjoy the company of friends or family, this won't disappoint.

y-4U3RH6Gr5vdqZf0eNpCw.text: If I lived in the South Hills I would come here all the time. I am not even sure how the pizza place across the street stays in business. I suspect that after the locals are done getting hammered off of Bado's awesome beer selection they need to order some crap when homebase has closed. Or it is a front for the mob.

nYg2dBTKeHZdV_C5KWo_Ow.text: Chili cheese omlette was amazing!  Great home fries and toast as well. Its gotta be the only place in town to watch early sporting events while eating breakfast. Service was very attentive.  My coffee cup never got below half full.

vQm6EoJqWNUNJ756Ed33qw.text: Went there on 1/31 (Friday) with my wife & other family members. Finding a parking space was kind of a pain. For those who don't know, Beverly Road has a one block business area in the middle of a residential area & parking is at a premium. Had to wait about 20-25 minutes for a table, so we had a couple drinks. Large beer selection & good bartenders.  Before I get into the food, I wish to comment on the wait staff, which consisted of mostly people in their late teens-early 20s. Maybe it's the times we live in, but many people have a notion that people in this age range are lazy & don't care much about the work they're doing. These people are the exact opposite. They were pleasant, helpful, & were busting a hump on that evening. Great job, guys!  I ordered the Pastrami Swiss burger. It was large & juicy, cooked to order & tasted good, but could've used more pastrami. Fries on the side could've used a little more of a crisp, but were tasty (& I'm not a big fan of french fries). The pizza that my wife & our company ordered looked very good.

OxxWi0u5Yzyf59A7aDVw3w.text: Large bar food menu and great selection of draft beers. Patio open in the summer and decent size restaurant. Large portions on food. Great Sicilian and speciality pizzas.

B9Et0av8btbeIrV-zQY-fw.text: I stopped by Bado's on a recent Wednesday for an early dinner with a friend. When I first walked in, I was rather surprised at the decor. The way Bado's is talked about and with this prime location, I imagined it to be more modern. I was wrong. Inside, it is your typical neighborhood pizza place/bar. Clean, well maintained but nothing shiny or fancy here. Looking over the menu, I noticed some classics and some distinct choices. Sandwiches, soups, salads, pizzas and calzones. Some with toppings/fillings you would not expect. Feeling unadventurous, we decided to order their (famous) wedding soup, a cheese pizza and a sausage calzone to be able to try a few of the classics. The soup came out first. The meatballs were tasty but otherwise, I'm not sure why it would be famous. It definitely did not stand out to me. Another item that did not stand out, the pizza. I was looking for something more. The pizza sauce was a bit tart for me. The real winner of the meal was the sausage calzone (which we added ricotta to). The sausage had a great spice to it. The heat was nicely complimented by the creamy cheese and crisp crust. Overall, good food for a neighborhood bar.

fdrf3V_fQZwLHlpDZ4r3TQ.text: I was here for the first time in years a few months back for lunch, and enjoyed it so much I came for dinner recently on a Friday night.   In my recent hungering for brewpubs with tasty food (and not just good beer), I was a little disappointed that dinner is mostly pizza and sandwiches, with just a few pasta entrees, but the burger I had was really tasty!  Thick and juicy and cooked the way I ordered, but the way you "make your own" is a slight downer; I'd like to see some gourmet-style suggestions like other places are doing lately.   The beer, however, is awesome. They have a great rotation on draft and lots to choose from. I didn't think the "specials" were anything that special price-wise, but the waiter had a long list of seasonal craft brews to choose from.   The service was great, the beer and food were delicious, but I think the menu could use a little more inspiration.

5IEK4MkxY62vA8C2Faf7CQ.text: I've had a few salads and pizzas at Bado's, and the food was very tasty every time. I'm more drawn to their wide variety of beers on draft. Also like that the alcohol content is specified. The drawbacks are that the service can be slow, even during non-busy times, and it seems a bit pricey to me. I usually get pizza delivered from down the street with similar quality but for less money, so even though I live right behind Bado's, it's not my first choice unless I want to walk somewhere and have a couple of drinks with my pizza. Last time I was there with a friend the server brought us our second round without us saying we wanted the same thing as before, which was kind of unusual and we didn't get to try something else from the extensive draft/bottle list.

cEKF4rTE721Ces-Oi0yp6A.text: This is some of the best american style pizza anywhere. Smaller, cheesier slices than New York style, order more than you than you usually eat, you'll want it.

6QRPmLiTQqEQ3nh9VXC9sA.text: I've been wanting to stop in here for the longest time.  Pizza, sandwiches, beer, what could go wrong?  Well, everything I guess.  The decor is kinda old and dated and dirtyish.  The server wasn't at all pleasant - I felt like we were keeping him from something.  I wasn't at all impressed with the beer selection but in fairness, I lean heavily on German wheats and the only thing that caught my eye was Franziskaner.  The food.  Well, it wasn't horrible but it also didn't blow me away.  Passable for bar food I suppose, but if I wanted a good pie for the same money, I'd be at A'Pizza Badamo on Washington.  My daughter who is a pizza fanatic only had a slice and a half before calling it quits - she's the expert and it says volumes when she won't eat more than a slice and a half.  The kids tried and rejected the pasta we got them to try as well as there was no taste to the sauce.  All in all, very disappointing in our book.  I can't imagine that we will be returning and that's a bummer as I had heard really good things about this place.

Bhud7xlXA7FcuejPTTqtZw.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh. Nice staff, and good beer selection. The variety changes a lot, but they'll always give you samples! You can buy growlers full of good stuff for fairly cheap, and get refills for even cheaper!

YwhYB3DeeQgyGRy3gCu09A.text: Love Bado's. Any pizza is really good and their rueben is very tasty. Lots of beer choices and they give out free samples.

xWYc79KjV7pVrsLbGFB89g.text: I came here for a few beers and some pizza.  I doubt that I'll go back.  The beer selection is a big plus.  There are a lot to choose from, and the prices are good.  We decided to get some calamari, which was a mistake.  The breading was mushy, the calamari was rubbery and tough, and the bottom of the basket was a gross pool of grease.  We grabbed a pesto pizza.  It was basically tasteless except for the sun dried tomatoes.  For the price, it was totally not worth it.  Our service was ok, though I did feel rushed.

bBapjkoj7oYUWr9qWo_cZQ.text: I was surprised initially to see an Italian Ale House. The food was pretty good and the atmosphere was pretty good as well. It was a short visit to PA for me but I would recommend this to someone else looking for some decent Italian food and a decent bar.

h-55Vr8HTn_Z4PK5rKroew.text: Good calzones and pizza. Also great for breakfast. They have takeout available also. Go to their website to get $5 off coupon.

Nb60zOKWwjnjZcwTYDKo1Q.text: I really enjoy going to Bado's. We mostly order the Gourmet Bianco Pizza, 4 slice for the two of us, with an appetizer and that is more than enough! We draws us there is the pizza and beer. The pizza is always amazing, and they have a great selection of beers on tap and in bottles. If you want to taste a beer on tap, just ask and they will bring you a little to try. The waitress's working weekends are pretty fantastic. The guys that work during the work are so-so. I don't have any experience with the bartenders, as we always sit at a table and eat. The one drawback for me is how it's a bit "too" family friendly for me. I love children (work with them everyday!) but it seems that families here feel comfortable letting their children do whatever they want. Maybe it's because the environment already seems loud, parents feel they can let their children misbehave and it will go unnoticed. I frequent this restaurant, and this seems to be he case most weekday evenings and weekends.

L_ncf_VbrH4A8FpDEQabAQ.text: got the buffet pizza was good they also give you free soup to .

f5C7PfBVMiE9EbIa8KQhog.text: I love their pizza! Deep dish with a ton of delish toppings. Also, a nice and diverse beer selection.

G2x3_2H1sKTmS2O59aAqOg.text: When you find a consistent restaurant with good food near your home, you tend to visit that restaurant a lot. For me, my fallback, can't miss restaurant is Bado's. First off, the menu is huge- pizza, hoagies, pasta, sandwiches, big burgers, Boarshead hotdogs, and huge apps. Everything I have tried there so far has been above average, except maybe their lasagna which I found to be watery and tasteless. If you get a salad, make sure you try their house dressing. It's their own vinaigrette that comes in a Grolsh bottle and is by far one of the best dressings I've ever had. Make sure you try it on the giant antipasti salad (which you should split with someone), and pair that with one of their calzones (my favorite is the reuben calzone, but the meatball is excellent as well). Their pizza buffet is also good if you want to try a lot of different toppings.  If you're looking for a good beer, Bado's has a great selection of craft and microbrews on their huge board, and the choices are always changing. You will also want to come to Bado's on weekend mornings for their breakfast. The omelets are huge and they have tons of toppings to choose from, and the rest of their breakfast choices are above average. Even the coffee is good! The drawbacks to Bado's are that they're almost always busy, and tables are a little cramped. Expect to wait a few minutes when you get there, and don't expect stellar service. The wait staff is good but they're always busy, so you'll probably be waiting for a refill. Also, I like to have fries with my sandwich or burger, and while their fries are pretty good, they don't have them as a side. You have to order off their appetizer menu, and the order is too big for one person and pricey.

3SOgyLfEgvnLed_otwHLgQ.text: Horrible. Their "Pittsburgh Style" sandwiches are absolutley nothing like primanti brothers. Way to expensive for bar food.

Nj25_L7ISTBjCd-b1flzEQ.text: I decided to give Bado's another shot after having a not so good experience the first time. The wait staff is just not friendly or helpful when asking questions about the menu. My boyfriend and I ordered wings and they were just terrible! Completely dried out with a terrible taste. Mentioned this to our waiter who stated that is how there wings taste. They half cook them until an order is placed and then deep fry them at the end. Waiter could care less about what we had to say. I can't justify going back.

ewe6qggtklix5zFcdwtIMw.text: The pizza is delicious, but a little pricy. A 4 cut is more than enough two people.  It's a good place for families and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. They have good specials do keep those in mind!

G7mOUr_3mNiqixZXz7ADRQ.text: Waste of time and money. Steer clear of this place very high prices small tables and very cramped.

_w8Vaayak9cWhU2N67SHoQ.text: BRAVO! We just had our first Bado's experience, and it most definitely won't be our last. This place doesn't get enough credit. Being new to the Mt. Lebo area I've heard so many things about Beto's. We've tried there, and while it wasn't bad, I just didn't see what the hype was about. I was way more impressed with Bado's! Their pizza was awesome!! Their beer selection is pretty extensive as well, especially for the size of the place. The food came out quickly, even though there wasn't an open seat in the whole place, bar included. Overall, great experience, food, and restaurant. I'm so glad it's a local joint. I love giving kudos to places like Bado's that truly deserve it!

7QUFVyds3v_QRQwWh8P_rg.text: Great little bar and pizza restaurant in Mt. Lebanon. I went for dinner her on Friday night and was not disappointed. They had a good beer list and the food was delicious. I had their onion rings and regular crust pizza. Will definitely be making this my pizza and beer go to.

fC43sAFlHi2dX0FwPKFPYg.text: I always get burgers and beer here even though they're known for their pizza. No regrets! Love their growlers too!

GxkWwu61FAqfkI_jeGZf4g.text: The service is always good and the food is good too. I really like the grilled chicken sandwich and the white pizza. Their takeout is also always quick and tasty! They also have a nice selection of craft beers.

yC8mVubi5g_znFVbH1jCvg.text: Wow! The pizza was awesome! I took my family on a Monday night, not very crowded (pre-MNF game time) and we ordered a 12 inch regular crust pepperoni with extra cheese and garlic pizza. It was incredible! The service was good and the waiter was very informative. The atmosphere was good. I recommend this pizza for dine in or carry out.

4T576H4cCq9YublVM6z9pg.text: Yummy yummy pizza!!! Excellent beer choices! The service was great. Everyone was personable. The wait was a little long and there is nowhere to stand yo wait but that is my on complaint. I would def go back.

3DUDIAeRoUSSNBzmVUaREQ.text: I've been wanting to try Bado's for awhile, and finally did a few days ago. I didn't want to leave the house, though, so I thought I'd check out their delivery service.   I got a thin crust pizza, and the only thing I didn't like was how floppy it was. It ended up being easier to cut it with a knife and fork than to hold it. Not a big deal, especially considering how tasty the pizza was! Fresh basil and garlic, and the pepperoni was nice and crispy and well cooked. It was an awesome indulgence.   Additionally, the driver was really personable, and my order was at my door in 40 minutes, which is a lot faster than I expected on a Friday night!   This is definitely going to become a staple of my Pittsburgh food experience!

MNvHjqGtXtXwsighF3hSPQ.text: The margarita pizza is the best! It's a great little spot with a bunch of beer choices, good food, and friendly service.

cv6Y8YRA3NddpUIau-zZLQ.text: I just want to like it due to its location and great beer selection, but the food is awful.

HrAV54Qim9373tHOo1_zDA.text: It should be 3.5 or 4 stars. The food was good as always, the atmosphere is warm and fun. We were able to talk and hear each other which was a great plus since the last two place we went to it was so loud we couldn't chat. There was one little blight on the night and I hate to mention it but it bothered us. Our server was very nice and did a fine job. I wouldn't want anything negative to happen because of this review but she should be counseled that this must go...The problem was her fingernails. They were excessively long, particularly for food service. I have experience in food service and dealing with health department requirements and just plain common sense. Fingernails are literally a hotbed of bacteria. I'm sure it was not sanitary under those nails but they were painted a bold color so if they were dirty she would never know it. Her nails were so long that they touched our plates and inside coffee cups. It was gross. So Bados, if you are reading this, please insist that your employees have short fingernails along with all the other sanitary practices you should follow when dealing with food.  We will go back of course. The food is too good to miss, we will just need a server who shows good hygiene practices for food service.

5aKacE9C_k9hMJ2ukLbZfw.text: Live close to this place and really like their selection of beers and pizza. However, the lunch pizza buffet left ALOT to desire. It was literally a few cold pizzas layed out on a little table. No salad, no breadsticks with it. It'd actually to be better to order a large, fresh hot pizza and share it. The 'buffet' was for sure a let down.

T0MuuS2USdf07Q_qeLAPOA.text: Since discovering this gem in the heart of beloved Mount Lebanon/Upper St. Clair country 10 years ago when my husband and I were dating, I've been in love it with ever since.    Located in an attractive, pleasant area perfect for taking a stroll with a warm, relaxed, welcoming atmosphere inside that has anything you're looking for.    Chill at a table with company or enjoy the liveliness often available... It's all good.  We've been happy with everything Bado's offers; but our favorites are the delicious pizza (perfect for eat-in or take-out) and drinks.  If we lived close-by, we'd be regulars.  The folks of Bado's make you want to keep coming back... They go the extra mile.    George, in particular, made our day recently.  He went out of his way to help us and our family have an experience we'll never forget.  Thank you, George!  We don't have enough words for our gratitude!    Once again, we'll be smiling about Bado's for quite a while.  I miss this place.  If you're nearby, be sure to enjoy it.  We do.

ProUv9OnAYIf8AdYNUhkYg.text: I have enjoyed Bado's many times. The pizza is great, and wings are pretty good too. BUT the last three times the staff has been awful. I'm not usually one to complain, as I know waiting sucks and people are awful. But the attitudes of the staff: servers, host, and bar, are not what I would expect. The shortness, negativity and scoffing when we ordered are unacceptable. I try and give the benefit of the doubt, maybe it's a bad day but when the same server presents the same way multiple times its him, not us. I suggest take out, because the food is still good!

7xLy8GAPzsGp9Ihj3PRkDw.text: I will never go back. Besides the gnocchi coming from a vacuum sealed bag, they offer a " Pittsburgh Sandwich " they don't know how to make. Served fries on the side and bagged coleslaw. Fries were an afterthought due to the pickle found underneath.  watched a young waiter spill two drinks, or e on a customer.  Same waiter after avoiding a table with cash payment, waiting for them to leave so he could pocket the change, finally got them change, as soon as they left he pulled out his wallet and put the tip inside.So unprofessional. Food from a box and under trained staff. Not if they begged would I go back.

7Me6XBjhbZJv_3vFWwpfxg.text: Meh. At best. So I went to Bado's tonight w/ my dad and sister and it was a bit lackluster. I started out with chicken noodle soup (w/ no noodles) and a very spicy bloody ( I know. I know. I am an avid evening bloody mary drinker.) The bloody mary was pretty awesome for what I assume is a pre-made mix. I also got a grilled swordfish salad which was bland as hell! Iceberg lettuce, croutons, cucumbers, and dry swordfish. Lame. My dad got a meatball casserole which is something I would have never ordered...meatballs and casserole aren't a selling point for me, let alone as a package deal.  This meatball casserole dish was just pasta and meatballs...thankfully for my dads heart.   My sister got a salad (again just iceberg lettuce, croutons, cucumbers) with chicken fingers.  She also split a small mushroom pizza with my dad which was above average.   I guess pizza is what Bados is known for so you should just stick with that if you go.    Pro: Spicy bloody marys, decent pizza, cute waiter, wide beer selection Con: bland salads, noodleless noodle soups, not many healthy options, no dinner entrees besides pasta,

S8JkzUberh9sCVb0jBW8Mw.text: Hostess was very awkward when seating us. Sat us in the corner in a small booth with a broken seat right up against another large party. The place was by no means busy. We sat and waited for someone to acknowledge us. We watched 4 members of the wait staff each attend to the 4 other tables and not one of them ever acknowledged us or came over. After 15 minutes of being ignored by staff, we got up and walked out. It's a shame too... we liked the looks of the menu and the bar list and specials. Don't think we'd ever come back after that. There are plenty of other places.

8QB9qnCXxkOTLyoAajeXxw.text: Large portions, good beer selection, straight to the point. Nothing fancy yet nice and comfy this place brings you a very friendly and yet upfront approach to some good food. I enjoy this place very much especially when ordering out.
